alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Sierra Madre Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 10:11PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Carbon County through 1045 PM MDT... At 1009 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Wamsutter to near Savery. Movement was east at 45 mph. Dixon airport reported a gust of 45 MPH at 950 PM MDT. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Encampment, Baggs, Dixon, Grand Encampment, Battle Lake, Dad, Jack Creek Campground, Haskins Creek Campground, Teton Reservoir, Savery, Lost Creek Campground, Little Sandstone Creek Campground, Hog Park Campground, Bottle Creek Campground, Battle Creek Campground, Hog Park Reservoir, Riverside and Slater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Sierra Madre Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
